newsitem.title: UK: UK shares end sharply higher amid bid speculation.
newsitem.headline: UK shares end sharply higher amid bid speculation.

text.p: UK shares ended sharply higher on Friday as continued takeover bid speculation overshadowed the reality of increased British interest rates and the threat of a U.S. fiscal tightening.
The FTSE 100 index of leading shares, which started the week at 4,621.3, closed at 4,645.0, up 68.8 points on the day but only 23.3 points firmer over the five-day period.

"It's been a good end to a nervy week," the head of trading at a large brokerage said. "We got a rate hike and the U.S. numbers out of the way without a major hiccup. Now all that's left is the (UK) Budget."
